abstract: The Dow and the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index rebounded Wednesday from 12-year lows, as stocks rose on expectations that China would increase its stimulus spending.
snippet: The Dow and the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index rebounded Wednesday from 12-year lows, as stocks rose on expectations that China would increase its stimulus spending.
lead_paragraph: Financial markets around the world snapped back after a week of relentless losses as investors speculated that China would increase its stimulus spending beyond the $585 billion plan it had already proposed.

byline.original: By Jack Healy and David Jolly
